definition: to investigate thoroughly/to carefully inspect/to verify/to ferret out (undesirable elements)
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge
surname Zha
to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)
see 山查[shan1 zha1]

sentences.english: So now is a good time to take stock of IT’s most hated power couple.
sentences.chinese: 因此现在是清查这对最被痛恨的组合的好时机。

sentences.english: Among those caught up in the sweep were some legal immigrants, in the background.
sentences.chinese: 在这些清查活动中被抓的人一些是合法移民。

sentences.english: All inventories shall be taken stock periodically.
sentences.chinese: 各种存货应当定期进行清查盘点。

sentences.english: Indirect Estimation is made to the value-added of self-employed according to the tax data and the number of individual business.
sentences.chinese: 个体经营户增加值根据税收资料和清查户数间接推算。

sentences.english: During Kangxi's reign in the Qing Dynasty, the government surveyed land throughout the country.
sentences.chinese: 康熙年间，清政府对全国土地进行清查和丈量。

sentences.english: The mayor has also stepped up raids on Chinese businesses.
sentences.chinese: 市长也加强了对中国商家的突击清查。

sentences.english: So make sure to check before just chomping on the first flower you recognize!
sentences.chinese: 所以在你食用之前确保检查清查花的属性。

sentences.english: We should finish the statistics and check all projects with false reports.
sentences.chinese: 统计工作，清查所有瞒产的项目。

definition: to investigate strictly
to search
to take inventory of and confiscate a criminal's possessions/to search and confiscate (forbidden items)/to raid
to investigate thoroughly
to tidy up/to reorganize/to consolidate/to rectify
to inspect/to run through a checklist/to take stock/to audit
to investigate and handle (a criminal case)
to bring under control/to regulate/to restore to good condition/(coll.) to fix (a person)/to prepare (a meal etc)
inspection
to patrol
to interrogate/to question (at a roadblock)
sudden unannounced investigation/on-the-spot inspection/to search without notification
to sequester/to seize (assets)/to seal up/to close down
to recover (illegally obtained property)/to seize/to capture/to force sb to hand over sth/to levy
to investigate and handle (a criminal case)
to find out/to ascertain/to get to the bottom of/to clarify
